results.description:
Join us for a once-in-a-lifetime, family-friendly event in Phillips Auditorium at the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics on Tuesday, July 14, between 7:30 PM and 9:30 PM. For 9-1/2 years, NASA’s New Horizons spacecraft has been coasting towards a fateful encounter with Pluto and its moons. On July 14th, it will arrive! After a journey of nearly a decade, its Close Encounter phase will last just 48 hours. During the busiest hours of the flyby - including the moment of closest approach - the spacecraft will be too busy to communicate with Earth as it soaks up all the data it can during its mad dash through the Pluto system. Once it resumes transmitting, it will still take an additional four hours for its signals, traveling at the speed of light, to reach Earth! But a lot could go wrong. At the speed it’s moving, it wouldn’t take much of a high-speed impact with any undiscovered moon, possible ring, or other unseen debris to disable or destroy the spacecraft just as it’s making its closest approach to the planet. Will New Horizons survive long enough to “Phone Home” and send us its treasure trove of images and measurements? We’ll know the minute that NASA does! We’ll be presenting a Live NASA TV broadcast from the Mission Operations Center, including interviews, videos, and status updates, right up until the receipt of the spacecraft’s “I survived” chirp (expected at 9:09 PM)!

Afterwards, if it’s clear, we’ll have telescopes on the roof aimed at Pluto’s location in the sky (plus other targets of opportunity). Pluto is too faint to be visible even in our telescopes, but it’s possible a few photons reflected by the planet may hit our retinas! It should all be great fun, as we’ll have a raffle, photo ops in front of an artistic Pluto landscape, 3D-printed models of New Horizons, and who knows what else! This will probably be the last time in our lives that we will be seeing a “New World” up close for the very first time. Don’t miss your chance!

The event will be hosted by the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics and presented by John Sheff, a NASA Solar System Ambassador and Boston-area amateur astronomer.

As with all CfA events, admission is free. No reservations are required; seating is first come first served.

We will open the doors at 7:00 and will be prepared to open overflow rooms if needed, as with our regular Observatory Night programs.

Clear skies,
Christine

Source(s):
eMail from Christine Pulliam

results.description:
Please RSVP! (E51-315  - 70 Memorial Dr. Cambridge, MA - map, parking and road closing info at bottom of announcement.

Myths and Realities of Options Probabilities and Greeks and Confidence

by Dan Passarelli

Sophisticated traders use models, Greeks, volatility data and other options-trading metrics to make critical trading decisions. However, many of these are based on flawed premises that can lead to ill-informed trading decisions and bad results. 

Attend this very special presentation and learn how to avoid traps that even some professionals fall into, and learn to correctly interpret commonly misinterpreted options metrics. In this presentation, you will learn:

How option probabilities change throughout the life of a trade and how to avoid incorrect interpretations of changing probability metrics.

How to understand volatility myths and realities (you’ll be surprised about how you've been misusing volatility readings).

How options Greeks change throughout the life of a trade and how to adapt your strategy.

When Greeks are essential to a trade’s outcome and when they are irrelevant.

How to trade with the confidence of a master trader, knowing your readings are accurate.

And much more!

This class will not be recorded and no Power Points or PDFs of the presentation will be made available, so please make every attempt to attend the live, in-person event.

Also, at the end of the presentation, Dan will offer a trader education package that includes his online Group Coaching class with additional learning resources at a special club discount only for traders who attend this event in person.

Following the presentation, Dan will be on hand for Q & A to help you with your trading questions.

Dan Passarelli is an author, trader and former member of the Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE) and CME Group. Dan has written four books on options trading, including “Trading Option Greeks” and “The Market Taker’s Edge.” He is also the founder and CEO of Market Taker Mentoring, Inc., a leading options education firm that provides online options education, options newsletters and personalized, one-on-one coaching for option traders.

Dan began his trading career on the floor of the CBOE as an equity options market maker. He also traded agricultural options and futures on the floor of the Chicago Board of Trade (now part of CME Group).  In 2005 Dan joined CBOE’s Options Institute and began teaching both basic and advanced trading concepts to retail traders, brokers, institutional traders, financial planners and advisors, money managers, and market makers. In addition to his work with the CBOE, he has taught options strategies at the Options Industry Council (OIC), the International Securities Exchange (ISE), CME Group, the Philadelphia Stock Exchange and many leading options-based brokerage firms. Dan also contributes to financial media such as TheStreet.com, FOX Business News, Bloomberg Television, BNN, National Public Radio (NPR), and the CBOE blog. And he has a weekly featured video on CBOE TV.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

MIT Building E51  is located at 70 Memorial Dr, but the entrance is at 2 Amherst St (put that in your GPS).   The section of Wadsworth Street East of Building E51 is closed for construction, and Ames Street is now two way from Memorial Drive to Amherst Street.  The best parking is in the "elbow" of Building E51, and there is also good parking at the Hayward St lot, about a block away.

Here is a map link: http://whereis.mit.edu/?go=E25

We strongly urge each person to make his or her own decisions about investing their money. Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone. This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships

 

 


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.


Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time. I have very limited access to the internet and that can make it difficult for me to respond to emails. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

 

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

These classes are not affiliated with any church or religion.

results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind


·  Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power

·  Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships

·  Learn to work constructively with your own emotions

·  Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities

·  Develop new resources and capabilities

·  Become clear about your life’s purpose

Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.

Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.

Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses

Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.

Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.

Discover the passion and power that resides within you

Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind

We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.

Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.

results.description:
{Unannounced}

Bottom Line


To understand the impact of an Insight II, look at the evidence from a previous Insight II:
- Examine their expressions as they describe their experience. 
- Read their comments 
- Email them and ask about its impact on them.


Do not cheat yourself and miss out on taking this seminar!

How to Register

Click here to register with Insight Seminars (and RSVP on this page)   

The price is $1,495 for first timers.
Audits pay $695 to retake Insight II.

Description of the Seminar

Insight II: The Opening Heart Seminar provides the opportunity to turn your dreams into reality through processes that encourage liberation and expansion. In this seminar you will discover self-imposed limitations that keep you from being, doing, and having all you want in life. As you tap into the courage of your heart, you will have the opportunity to walk boldly toward your dreams without being hindered by fear, doubt, or limitations.

Many graduates describe this seminar as the most moving, liberating, and profound experience they have ever had, serving as a touchstone for the rest of their lives!

Insight II: The Opening Heart Seminar is an advanced seminar that takes place over five days. Personal attention is given to participants in every major process. You will expand on what you learned in Insight I in ways that augment and complement your new skills. Your commitment to your Self will be rewarded with the experience of greater freedom and discernment in choosing healthier life enhancing relationships.

The Insight II seminar is an intensive, dynamic five-day small group experience. With a maximum of 40 participants, strong bonds of trust and acceptance are quickly created and mutual respect and support are nurtured.

Similar in some aspects to Insight I, the Insight II seminar places a greater emphasis on individual participation, games, interaction, and processes than on lecturettes.

Profound breakthroughs in self-knowledge and a greater sense of expansion and empowerment are hallmarks of the Insight II experience.

Objectives of the Insight II seminar include:
• Cultivating greater ability to access loving, wisdom, intuition and strength-of-heart
• Learning to release and heal limited patterns of thinking, feeling and behaving
• Recognizing and experiencing the beauty of our Essential Nature
• Expanding and trusting authentic Self-expression
• Strengthening and healing relationships
• Discovering and expressing talents
• Gaining confidence in the ability to have, do and be what one dreams of in life
• Discovering what’s really important
• Creating a positive peak experience reference point and tools to guide participants through life outside the seminar

Times:
Tentative Times are:
Wed: Registration 10A; Seminar: 11A-11P
Thur: 11A-11P
Fri: 11A-11P
Sat: 10A-11P
Sun: 11A-8P; Graduation: 8P-9P

Start times are firm.  Ending times depend on the group's dynamics.  Please expect to focus entirely on this experience during these five days; you will enjoy it.  You will want uninterrupted sleep and there is homework that will take up the morning.

Food
Arrive having eaten a hearty breakfast.  There are breaks every two-three hours.  Take snacks if you need them.  There is one lengthy (1.5 hour) break for a meal.  Many participants go out together to the many restaurants.  Some bring meals with them but note there are no refrigerators or microwaves in the hallway of the seminar.

Prerequisite: Insight I (Available here)

A Last Word

Representing education in its most essential sense, Insight II shines light on what is already inside each participant, rather than attempting to impart external information to them.

The Insight II process provides numerous contexts for examining deep-seated beliefs and behaviors, so students can determine which support them in their deeper purpose and which hold them back. From an expanded perspective, participants can make choices that serve them in relating, working and living more effectively. Insight II broadens and deepens the self-exploration work begun in Insight I. For many students, this seminar creates an opportunity for them to open to the magnificence of their authentic Self.

Janet Parker


Janet Parker has devoted over 20 years, as a facilitator of personal growth seminars, as a facilitator of business training programs, and as a personal coach, to help people in all walks of life create happier and more fulfilling lives.  

Ms. Parker is a facilitator with Insight Seminars, and also leads her own workshops including The Lifewise Series, The Chalice for Women and the Teen Leadership Seminar. Janet's facilitation is recognized and respected around the world, having facilitated seminars for adults, teens, and children across the U.S. and in Europe, the Caribbean, South America and Israel.  Her clients describe her style as dynamic, inspiring, compassionate, and creative.

She also develops and facilitates training programs for businesses in leadership, communication skills, and teamwork. Clients have included Partners Healthcare, Polaroid, Mastercard, and Compaq. She also regularly consults with non-profits in the Boston area (e.g., schools).

In addition, Janet is a professional coach, certified by the International Coaching Federation.  She works intensively one-on-one with individuals to more quickly achieve their personal and professional goals.


{Find more Insight events on the Insight Calendar.}

results.description:
#FICHATS are a question-and-answer interactive webinar that helps entrepreneurs solve complex problems. 

For this event, the topic is “How to Secure a Lead Investor”, covering in-depth and practical topics on starting the fundraising process for your company or idea. 

Answering your questions on this webinar will be Carter Laren, a Silicon Valley Angel Investor and engineer who built-out the Blu-Ray technology. With over ten years of experience launching businesses and coaching entrepreneurs, Carter has developed the curriculum and co-directed our Advanced Founder Lab program, which provides promising seed-stage startups the opportunity to spend a week in Silicon Valley getting ready for funding with the world's best founders and investors.

Tune in to get your questions about startup funding answered straight from a Silicon Valley expert!

-----

This is a free, online event that you can watch and participate in from your computer. 

To get access and receive the link to this private event, you must register at http://bit.ly/FICHAT-1. This is a requirement because we are using GoToWebinar to host this online event.

If you’d like to be the first to get your questions answered during the chat, tweet your inquiries using the hashtag #FIChat. If you can’t make the online event, still tweet your questions and we will provide answers.

-----

This webinar will be held in English, and will last approximately 1 hour. We will also share a video of the webinar a few days after it ends.

For more information on Founder Institute Webinars, visit http://fi.co/webinars.
results.name: How To Secure a Lead Investor - Q&A Live #FICHAT Webinar

results.description:
We have an exciting Yarnstorm project happening this fall!

Led by Jen Fuchel, Sandy McDonald and Alice Sajdera, the Nave Gallery will yarnstorm a Somerville park late September. This installation will be connected to the Wrap Around Project, which raises awareness and funds for the Somerville Homeless Coalition.

We will yarnstorm four trees in one of Somerville’s parks. Each tree will have a social justice theme and an individual color scheme.


Inspired by mosaic, we are basing the construction of the pieces on multiples of 4” (4”x4”; 4”x8”; 8”x16”; etc). We need squares and rectangles of all kinds: plain and elaborate.

THEMES & COLOR SCHEMES:

Theme: Food security
Color scheme: Purples, Greens, Creams, Tans

Theme: Education
Color scheme: Blues and Black

Theme: Housing
Color scheme: Oranges, Reds and Browns

Theme: Community
Color scheme: Browns, Pinks, Creams, Tans

Full details: http://navegallery.org/wp/call-for-yarnstorm-contributions/

Come by to help officially kick off this project, make some pieces for the trees and learn lots more about what is going on.
results.name: Yarnstorm Kick-Off

results.description:
You may not know it, but the original parcel of land that founded the Audobon Society is not even one block off Beacon Street, right where Brookline and Boston meet. That piece of land is kept wild and free, and even though it’s small, you can find a bountiful variety of birds there – and wild medicinal plants!

The ability to identify and use each of these plants was once commonplace to every man, woman, and child, but today most of us have lost that knowledge. Come reclaim what’s yours!

Join us regularly throughout the growing seasons and learn the plants in all of their stages of growth. By the end of these sessions, you’ll feel confident in your ability to identify the many medicinal plants growing right in the middle of the city – and you’ll learn how you can work with them!

Wednesday, July 15th, 2015
5:30 – 6:30pm
Hall’s Pond Sanctuary, Brookline MA 02446

A map of our meeting place can be found here:
http://commonwealthherbs.com/halls-pond-herb-walk-brookline/

Meet at the gate near the tennis courts, just off Beacon Street near the Hawes Street T stop. We’ll get started right at 5:30 and wrap up by 6:30. Feel free to bring a notebook or sketchbook, cameras, etc. The fee for the herb walk is $5.

Herb walks are “Sprinkle or Shine!” – if it’s just damp or a bit drizzly, we’ll walk anyway. If it’s raining enough to need an umbrella, that makes it hard to learn, so we will cancel in that event.
results.name: Hall's Pond Herb Walk, Brookline

results.description:
Hosted by: Beyond Your Hammock & Claudia Connects

Beyond Your Hammock and Claudia Connects are back to bring you another A Night in the Hammock!! As most of you know by now, this isn't your typical networking event. It's social... it's business... it's life! 

Have you found the key to success? Great, come share it with us. Are you stuck in a rut? Not so great, but come share that as well. Our goal is to create an environment that supports you in getting to the next level, no matter where you might be today. Now is only temporary and we have 100% of our lives to live. Let's make the most of it! 

There will be complimentary crudité and cheese and crackers. Also, if you are driving to the event, you can park at 75 State Street and the Harborside Inn will validate your ticket for a discounted rate.

Please check out photos from our May 20th event.

Thank you!

"The discomfort of choosing to do something outside of your comfort zone is temporary... it's the distress of not doing it that lasts forever."  - Eric Roberge, Founder of Beyond Your Hammock

Thank you!
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be the lady near the hammock! ;)
results.name: Networking Happy Hour

results.description:
Hi All!
A number of you have shown interest in a weekday evening meetup in the downtown Boston area. Here it is! Please come and join us for a casual 2 hours ASL social on Wednesdays from 5:30 to 7:30 pm.


WHO: All who are interested in ASL are welcome to join us. Whether you're Deaf or hearing, beginner or fluent ASL user, we're here to share and socialize in this beautiful language.

WHERE: We'll be in the Starbucks on 755 Boylston Street in Back Bay. Since we'll most likely be the only group of people signing, we should be pretty easy to spot.

RULES: Voices off, use paper and pen if you need to--this helps us learn and its Deaf friendly


RESOURCES: For those of you who are new to ASL and want to come prepared, here are some very good websites with free online classes.

http://www.westwoodasl.com/ http://www.lifeprint.com/ http://www.start-american-sign-language.com/

RSVP: Please RSVP for the meetup that you will be attending so we know how many people to expect.

CONTACT: Please feel free to contact host (Sean) if you have any questions or concerns. Hope to see you there! :)
results.how_to_find_us: Look for people signing!
results.name: Downtown Boston Weekly ASL Social

Beyond Your Hammock and Claudia Connects are back to bring you another A Night in the Hammock!! As most of you know by now, this isn't your typical networking event. It's social... it's business... it's life!

Have you found the key to success? Great, come share it with us. Are you stuck in a rut? Not so great, but come share that as well. Our goal is to create an environment that supports you in getting to the next level, no matter where you might be today. Now is only temporary and we have 100% of our lives to live. Let's make the most of it!

There will be complimentary crudité and cheese and crackers. Also, if you are driving to the event, you can park at 75 State Street and the Harborside Inn will validate your ticket for a discounted rate.

Please check out photos from our May 20th event.

Thank you!

"The discomfort of choosing to do something outside of your comfort zone is temporary... it's the distress of not doing it that lasts forever."  - Eric Roberge, Founder of Beyond Your Hammock
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be the lady near the hammock! ;)
results.name: Networking Happy Hour

results.description:
Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. New paddlers welcome at all times of the season.

Mon & Wed: 6pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm by the grassy patch near Barking Crab.  
Sat: 11am - 1pm, meet 10.45am by the grassy patch near Barking Crab.

Price: New paddler 2-class pack for $10. All other paddlers paddle unlimited under the $110 annual membership fee. New paddlers who have purchased the $10 intro pack get a $10 deduction from $110 membership!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather! Be prepared to get wet!

Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards.  
Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended.  
Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen.

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locker provided on-site.

Please sign our e-Waiver before you get on the water

Hope to see you there!

Lily[masked]

 

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

 

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $6 flat rate.

Public Transport: Closest MBTA stop is South Station on the Red Line.
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on the grassy patch between the Children's Museum & the Barking Crab Restaurant
results.name: Wednesday Water Training

results.description:
Summer is here! Time for Midsummer Nights' Science at the Broad Institute. This annual lecture series explores key advances in genomics and medicine. This lecture series is held each summer, and is free and open to the general public. Midsummer Nights' Science at the Broad Institute takes place at 415 Main Street (formerly 7 Cambridge Center), in Kendall Square in Cambridge.

I am coming directly from work, so depending on the T, I will be there as close to 5:30 as I can. We will head in for seats by 6:45. I will be wearing a meetup pin.

If you are concerned about getting good seats, as this is a popular event, feel free to go in when you arrive.

There is a reception in the lobby after, but I would rather go to dinner with some fellow nerds and discuss the lecture, and whatever else we would like to talk about. I will wait in the lobby by the doors for a few minutes before heading out to get dinner. Come find the group if you want to join us.

Please remember you have to register:

To Register

Wednesday, July 15, 6-7pm
Understanding and controlling malaria through evolution.

Malaria is a disease of seemingly gratuitous complexity, caused by Plasmodium parasites which must complete intricate phases of their life cycle in two very different hosts: vertebrates and mosquitoes. Understanding the adaptations that facilitate and maintain the relationships between the members of this co-evolutionary triangle can give us insight into the fascinating biology of malaria, and also provide keys to controlling or eventually eliminating this disease. Daniel Neafsey, associate director of the Broad’s Genomic Center for Infectious Disease, will describe how recent developments in genome sequencing are giving us new perspectives on malaria, a disease that has been called the strongest known force of evolutionary selection in the recent history of the human genome.

Dan Neafsey
Daniel Neafsey joined the Broad in 2004 and is now associate director of the Broad Institute’s Genomic Center for Infectious Disease, where he leads a group that focuses on the genomics of malaria parasites and mosquito vectors. He is excited by the potential for new technology and bioinformatic approaches to turn the tide against disease like malaria. Neafsey’s current projects involve the application of comparative genomic and population genetic analyses to Plasmodium malaria parasites and Anopheles mosquitoes to study population structure, natural selection, and genomic factors underlying parasite and vector phenotypes that impact public health. Neafsey’s interests also include the use of pathogen polymorphism data to inform vaccine design and understand vaccine efficacy; analysis of drug resistance mechanisms and evolution; the use of clinical genotyping data to interpret disease transmission dynamics; and the development of new genomic protocols and informatic tools to address key questions in infectious disease and global health.

Before joining the Broad, Neafsey received his B.A. at Loyola University (Chicago) and completed his Ph.D. at Harvard University, with a focus on population genetics and genome size evolution of pufferfish (a short-lived model organism for genome studies and exceedingly minor threat to public health). He received the Broad’s inaugural Excellence Award in Science/Engineering in 2013.
results.name: Midsummer Nights' Science 2015:  Malaria

results.description:
Come join me in exploring two great Photography exhibitions at the MFA Free Wednesdays

Herb Ritts 

(1952–2002) was a leading American fashion photographer of the 1980s and 1990s, known for his beautifully printed, formally bold, and sensual black-and-white images of supermodels such as Cindy Crawford and Naomi Campbell. This new exhibition of the photographer’s work revisits the artist, whose groundbreaking 1996 retrospective, “Herb Ritts: WORK,” remains one of the most popular exhibitions in MFA history. The Ritts Foundation has given the Museum a print of every image in the 1996 exhibition, and in 2007, supported the MFA’s first gallery dedicated solely to photography. The Museum’s Herb Ritts and Clementine Brown galleries host the new exhibition, featuring an array of Ritts’s photographs celebrating the human body and embracing the carefree California lifestyle.

Unfinished Stories: Snapshots from the Peter J. Cohen Collection


Spanning the 20th century, the more than 100 found photographs in “Unfinished Stories” depict a century of image-making by private photographers. “A quick shot fired by a hunter without deliberate aim,” reads the original definition of a snapshot from the early 19th century. The term “snapshot,” popularized shortly after the invention of Kodak’s box camera in the 1880s, came to describe photographs of everyday life using a handheld camera. Speedy new technology boosted the ability to create a visual diary, commemorating events and personal moments, road trips and holidays. Now, more than a century later, these once ubiquitous and now historic, silver gelatin photographs are rapidly being replaced by Instagram and other digital forms of photography, hence a new appreciate for such photographs.

“Unfinished Stories” celebrates a century of snapshots from the Peter J. Cohen Collection of amateur photographs. An avid collector, Cohen rescued more than 50,000 lost, discarded, or disowned personal photographs, culled from flea markets, antique shops, galleries, eBay, and private dealers. As he sifted and sorted through his finds, Cohen discovered mesmerizing, often humorous, shots removed from their original context: People at Play, Photographers’ Shadows, Double Exposure, Couples, Oddities, and Hula Madness. These pictures reveal the lives of strangers through intimate exposures, telling a story, or as Cohen puts it, “a teeny part of a story that remains unfinished.”

“Unfinished Stories” celebrates unexpected discoveries in these compelling visual objects, each representative of what makes photography such a rich form of expression and a deep cultural symbol for everyone who’s had to stand still and say, “Cheese!”
results.name: MFA - Free Wednesday Art of Photography

Recent lesson learned: Never pull a ticket for NY to LA when another player only has 8 trains left. Keep those eyes open.

results.description:
Please join us for networking and a discussion with Dr. Simone Schürle on July 15th. She will discuss: "Microrobots for Biomedical Applications: Insights into current trends in the emerging field of biomicrorobotics"

Microrobots are miniature robots at the microscale with exciting applications in biomedicine.  In addition to discussing how such tiny devices can be built and powered, we will also talk about how these devices can be used in real-world applications. 

Dr. Schürle’s  is currently at the Koch Institute for Integrative Cancer Research at MIT where she is applying microrobotic control strategies in cancer diagnosis and therapy. She is also co-founder of MagnebotiX, a young spin-off company from ETH focusing on magnetic manipulation systems for crystallography applications. 

Refreshments provided by Helbling (6pm-8pm).

Agenda:
6:00-6:30 Refreshments (Swiss Bakers) and Networking
6:30-7:30 Dr. Simone Schürle
7:30-8:00 Networking
Then join us for the afterparty at Firebrand Saints!

IMPORTANT: Cambridge Innovation Center (CIC) is a secured facility, so you will need to check in at the security desk on the first floor.  Please bring a photo ID.  The CIC can be busy afterwork with events like these, so we suggest arriving early in case there is a line at the security desk.  Your security check-in experience will be faster if your meetup.com account name matches the full name on your ID.

GETTING HERE:
Kendall Square T Stop (Red Line) is across the street from the Cambridge Innovation Center. There are a number of pay parking lots in the area.  There is free parking in the MIT Hayward Lot after 5pm.
results.name: Microrobots for Biomedical Applications with Dr. Simone Schürle

Please join us on Wednesday, July 15th for a discussion on the API economy and how APIs are enabling companies to rapidly react to competitive pressures and engage in new business models.  Learn how organizations across industries are exposing core assets for consumption by internal and external developers to drive innovation across mobile and web applications to deliver a customized user experience.

Speaker - Vic Germani, IBM Client Technical Specialist & Adam Loffredo, North American Sales Leader

Adam Loffredo will provide a foundation of what APIs are, what they do, and why they are important while describing common use cases.  Vic Germani will follow that by presenting a solution demo to complete the picture of how organizations can leverage APIs to enter the Digital Economy. 

Agenda


+Dinner and Networking

+Foundation overview


+Discuss Use Cases


+Demo

results.description:
The Revolve Nation's Boston Entrepreneurs Network is the largest community of entrepreneurs and business owners in the city of Boston, offering networking, discussion groups, seminars, business plan hot-seats, and more!

Join us here, where professionals and entrepreneurs meet in mutual support of business to network, socialize, learn, and promote a thriving community of entrepreneurs. Wine and snacks provided!

Schedule:

6pm-6:30pm  -- Open Networking over wine and snacks

6:30-6:45pm  -- Meeting Called to Order and Introductions

6:45--7:45pm -- Open discussions on topics of interest to our members (examples; Getting funded, building a team, using mailing lists and their effectiveness, firing a difficult employee) Suggest your own topics as comments on the event, or simply bring them with you!

7:45-8:00pm  -- More Networking! (and wine!)

Like anything in life, what you put into a networking group is what you get out of it. The Boston Entrepreneurs Group is designed for entrepreneurs and professionals who are serious about building their business, investing in relationships, and helping each other to succeed.

The way the group seeks to achieve these outcomes:

1) Regular attendance

2) Dedication to coming prepared to contribute value to the community with expertise, experience, and networks.

3) Create a fun and supportive environment!

Price: FREE

SPONSORS: Revolve, Inc.: www.revolvethis.com

Exemplar Law: www.exemplarcompanies.com

See you soon!

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

A number of folks living NORTH of Boston have asked about an ASL SOCIAL. Let's make this happen!

On WEDNESDAYS, starting October 29 - 6pm to 8pm - I / we will be at the NORTH SHORE MALL Food Court.

While technology has improved the way people communicate, "Deaf Social Clubs" are slowly disappearing. This is a way to start bringing REAL social interaction back!

Please join us for a casual, relaxed, no-pressure two-hour Social, where we can chat, tell stories, get to know each other, and meet new people (or old friends!). Friends, Fun and Food!

A warm welcome is extended to all Deaf & non-Deaf people: folks in the Deaf Community, CODA's, Interpreters, ASL students, parents of deaf children AND their children, ASL professors/teachers, Relay Operators, Deaf services workers- EVERYONE!

This will be a "SOME ASL KNOWLEDGE and ABOVE" Social, because not all of us are ASL-fluent! "Voices- Off" -- we'll all laugh & learn WITH and FROM each other!

WHAT: ASL SOCIAL CLUB
WHERE: North Shore Mall Food Court, PEABODY,MA
DAY/TIME: Wednesdays, 6pm - 8pm
WHY: To meet like-minded people, socialize using ASL, tell stories, and have good time!
WHO: Anyone who wants to chat using American Sign Language!
HOW TO FIND US:  We'll be sitting on the couches closest to the "walkway" side of the Food Court, not hidden inside the food court, so easier to locate us!

If you have any question, please contact Connie or Paul I., through the EMAIL LINK via BOSTON ASL profile page.

PLEASE, if you would be good enough, RSVP either "YES" or "NO" so I know who to look for!

CHEERS!

Connie Cassidy / Paul I.

PEACE...
results.why: ASL is the third largest "foreign language" in the U.S.; ASL is fun to use; ASL is NOT English, but does "borrow" from the English language.
results.how_to_find_us: The folks talking with their hands!
results.name: Weekly North Shore ASL Social!

results.description:
It doesn’t take long to learn the roles and ceremonies of Scrum. So why do some teams get a lot out of Scrum, and others do not? This talk will review the Scrum fundamentals, and then dive into areas that can greatly benefit or hinder a team. Some of this is about understanding the fundamentals, and some of this is anecdotal. This should be a fun talk.

About the Speaker

Randy Bone has worked in all aspects of software development since earning a degree in Computer Science back in the 1980s. He got started using Scrum in 2009, and is a Certified Scrum Master and Certified Scrum Product Owner. Randy continues to work primarily as a software developer, though he’s worked with several teams who have made the jump from Waterfall to Agile. He enjoys travel, software and agile conferences, and learning about cultures from around the world. Randy is a Senior Software Engineer at Jacobs Technology, Inc. He is a long-time member of Boston PHP and has completed five virtual self-study groups.


Agenda

6:00 pm - 7:00 pm -- Free pizza provided by our sponsor

7:00 pm - 7:15 pm -- Announcements 

7:15 pm - 8:30 pm -- Scrum: Values and Getting Value

8:30 pm - 8:45 pm -- Questions, comments and feedback 

9:00 pm - ? More Talk after The Talk at Champions Sports Bar
results.name: Scrum: Values and Getting Value

results.description:
Please join us for networking and a discussion with Dr. Simone Schürle on July 15th. She will discuss: "Microrobots for Biomedical Applications: Insights into current trends in the emerging field of biomicrorobotics"

Microrobots are miniature robots at the microscale with exciting applications in biomedicine. In addition to discussing how such tiny devices can be built and powered, we will also talk about how these devices can be used in real-world applications. Dr. Schürle’s is currently at the Koch Institute for Integrative Cancer Research at MIT where she is applying microrobotic control strategies in cancer diagnosis and therapy. She is also co-founder of MagnebotiX, a young spin-off company from ETH focusing on magnetic manipulation systems for crystallography applications. Refreshments provided by Helbling (6pm-8pm).

Agenda:
6:00-6:30 Refreshments (Swiss Bakers) and Networking
6:30-7:30 Dr. Simone Schürle
7:30-8:00 Networking
Then join us for the afterparty at Firebrand Saints!

IMPORTANT: Cambridge Innovation Center (CIC) is a secured facility, so you will need to check in at the security desk on the first floor. Please bring a photo ID. The CIC can be busy afterwork with events like these, so we suggest arriving early in case there is a line at the security desk. Your security check-in experience will be faster if your meetup.com account name matches the full name on your ID.

GETTING HERE:
Kendall Square T Stop (Red Line) is across the street from the Cambridge Innovation Center. There are a number of pay parking lots in the area. There is free parking in the MIT Hayward Lot after 5pm.

This is a free event but you still need to RSVP through: http://www.meetup.com/Helbling-Visionary-Series/events/223112209/
results.name: Helbling: Microrobots for Biomedical Applications with Dr. Simone Schürle

results.description:
UPDATE 7/15: Please bring a laptop (if possible).

We're excited to host an interactive career success program presented by Melissa James, Founder and CEO of The Tech Connection. Melissa's bio and the description of her session are below. We hope you'll join us!

Are you curious about what a hiring manager at a tech company is looking for? Are you looking for technical interview training? Are you looking for feedback on your interviewing skills? Join us for a career management seminar by Melissa James, an ex-Googler who loves teaching the ins and outs of successful interviewing.

Good interviewing is a skill that will lead you to ultimate career success. In this session, Melissa will walk attendees through three essential steps for career success that have helped hundreds of tech rockstars think strategically about their first five years of experience:

• Improving your self confidence to ace the interview

• Effectively communicating your career aspirations

• Knowing what to say when you get stumped

Melissa James is championing the initiative to infuse diversity into the tech industry. Over the last five years, Melissa has recruited technical talent for Google, Teradata, RA Capital, and Sample6. In 2014, Melissa began The Tech Connection to help candidates from underrepresented backgrounds think strategically about their career goals. Melissa is the recipient of the President’s Volunteer Service Award and the Black Student Leadership Scholarship, and she was recently featured as a “Woman on the Move” by Boston Business Journal.

Schedule

Doors open at 6:00pm; if you arrive before 6:00pm, please wait in the 1st floor lobby, as no one will be available to let you in upstairs. We encourage you to arrive by 6:15pm to get a good seat and meet other attendees. The talk will begin promptly at 6:30pm.

Location

14th Floor, Room Charles

Cambridge Innovation Center

1 Broadway


Cambridge, MA 02142

T Stop: Kendall/MIT

Metered street parking is available (but limited) on Broadway St., Third St., and Main St.

Access

Please bring photo ID. Upon entering 1 Broadway you'll check in with security. Tell them you're here for the Women's Coding Collective event on the 14th floor.

Once you depart the elevator, you'll find glass doors that are locked. Look for the tablet door sign and find your name in the list to ring the doorbell.

We're meeting in the room labeled Charles.
results.name: Career Management 101: How to Be Strategic

results.description:
Another open spaces Meetup in the spirit of DevOpsDays! Bring some devops-"y" issues you'd like to talk about with the group.

The theme of this event is making decisions - how do the organizations we are a part of make decisions, technical or otherwise? Are there improvements we can make in this process?

how it works:

1. You write an 'issue' you would like to discuss and present it to the group (briefly).

2. We'll organize the issues into a timeline, so people can move from group to group.

3. When we run out of ideas or timeline space, we break out into groups and start talking.

This format is based on how they do it at devopsdays. Check the link for more info.

If you can't think of an issue to discuss, no problem. You can join breakout groups based on your interest.

some ideas as examples:

• Build vs buy

• What will DevOps look like for us?


• Staffing - who do we need, and when?


• Tooling decisions in and across teams


• Events - what do we go to, do we sponsor?

• and so on...


See you all at TeraData on July 15th!
results.name: Open Spaces IV - Making Decisions

results.description:
Come watch a film real quick and learn something about Institutional, Internal, Structural and Interpersonal racism through the power of personal stories. 

Cracking the Codes is an amazing film and tool for conversations around understanding race and racism. 

We will watch the film and discuss the following:

1) Which tenants of racism do you find hardest to discuss? Explain?

2) What stories do we have that are similar to the interviewees? Were any shocking or unnerving?

3) What's the effect of the conversation not being had?

This is a GREAT film/event to bring a friend, partner or other loved one with whom you want to begin the conversation.

Watch the trailer!

WE ARE BACK IN DAVIS SQUARE, PLEASE TAKE NOTE OF THIS.

6:30-6:45 pm - Warm up & practice, we'll work on some throws, passes & catches.

6:45 pm - Game starts.

General guidelines: Dress accordingly. Bring a white & dark shirt so we can easily divide into 2 teams. Have plenty of water. Sunscreen on a sunny day. Stretch & warm up. We'll provide discs and cones.

Weather: Rain in New England is unpredictable. We will send out a final notice one hour before start time if cancellation is necessary.

RSVP: Very helpful as this is how we contact you in case of game changes & cancellations.

About: Playing Ultimate is all about good sportsmanship, respect, and gracefulness on the field.  Fun & having a good time is a must above anything else. It's an easy game to pick up & we keep the rules minimal. No zones, no stall count, no scores, and players self-officiate on the field.  Open to all levels of players.  Beginners welcome.

Warning: Excessive fun & comradery developed from playing Ultimate may become addicting.

Come join David and friends for a night of Magic: The Gathering over at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford. This event is part of our "Wednesday Night Magic" series.

It doesn't matter if you are an expert "planeswalker", or don't know anything about Magic: The Gathering -- you can come to play or learn this amazing strategy game.  There are usually between 6-12 people at each event, consisting of all experience levels.  All decks of all types are welcome for this "casual play" event.  Beginners who want to learn are welcome!

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that MTG Boston members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.

results.description:
WEE-HAW!

Lets get together for a private screening of the fantastically funny and influential wine film "Sideways" at the movie screening room in my apartment building Hanover CambridgePark.

This venue is like something you would find in a movie producer's home! To minimize potential stains on the rug, I will select 3 or 4 summer whites to taste. We still can bring food of course, but let's try to keep it neat. Food ideas to follow.

LOOK! Movie -- and security -- start at 7pm on the dot; please plan to arrive 6:30. Helpers at 6pm.


Sideways won the Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay, and was nominated for four other awards. It profoundly affected the wine biz here in the US: Mile's famous love monologue to Pinot Noir caused sales -- and prices -- to jump. Likewise, his rant "If those bi*ches order Merlot I'm out of here!" depressed Merlot sales til this day. But there's a twist, which I encourage all of you to research and discover for yourselves. There will be a quiz.

COST

$20 when you RSVP.

NOTE: We are now using Meetup's preferred payment service WePay. Let Jim know if there are any issues.

Usual refund policy applies. I will refund 100% up to 1 day in advance of the event. After that time, no refund (but members are free to work out swaps on their own).

POLICIES

Seats are limited to 18 total, so no guests. RSVPs will be rolled out over a few weeks, and I may promote newbies up from wait list. Everyone must be a member of BostonWine or live at Hanover. RSVP early, but please don't RSVP unless you're sure that you can make it.

NOTE: As part of the RSVP process you will be asked to accept the group's Policies and Disclaimer (use a new web browser window to see the About Us section of our group). You must answer "Yes" in the RSVP to attend this event. (Note, apparently some versions of the Meetup mobile app don't display this question -- in that case, use a web browser later on to update your RSVP). 

Sideways is a 2004 comedy-drama film written by Jim Taylor and Alexander Payne and directed by Payne. Adapted from Rex Pickett's 2004 novel of the same name, Sideways follows men in their forties, Miles Raymond (Paul Giamatti) and Jack Cole (Thomas Haden Church), who take a week-long road trip to Santa Barbara County Wine Country. Payne and Taylor won multiple awards for their screenplay. Giamatti and Church, as well as actresses Virginia Madsen and Sandra Oh, playing local women who become romantically involved with the men, all received accolades for their performances.

WHAT TO BRING

We will supply wine. You should bring food, plates, wine glasses, etc.

WINE

1. 2014 Limestone Hill Chardonnay from de Wetshof Estate, Roberson, South Africa $15. Wow! Hard to beat this one: unoaked, so crisp with grapefruit and pear nose, followed by minerals on the palate from the limestone, THEN rich butter like a California chard. Very nice! I'll bring some smoked salmon salad on "petites toasts" to go with. :-)

2. 2012 Pouilly-Fumé "En Travertin" from Henri Bourgeois, Sauvignon Blanc from the Loire valley, France, $23. Strong classic "gun flint", smokey Sauvignon Blanc nose, similar to a Sancerre which is near by. This wine was recommended by our member Daniel and I think it would be fantastic with any kind of goat cheese.

3. 2012 Gewurztraminer, Trimbach, Alsace, France, $23. Ahh, Gewurz! Dry, but with an incredibly fragrant, spicy nose. Trimbach is a solid producer so this will give you a good introduction to a classic grape and style. Wonderful sipping on its own, superb with fondue (!!), or with vinegary Alsatian or German food (e.g., German potato salad).

4. 2013 Vigneti Di Foscarino Soave Classico, Inama, Verona Italy, $24. We'll finish with this Italian white from the Venice area. I haven't had it, but reviews are excellent and this is a top producer. Complex floral / pear nose, rich in the mouth, some describe it as oily, some lemon and minerals. Summer in Venice, what could be better?


WHERE

Hanover CambridgePark 
160 CambridgePark Drive 
Cambridge, MA 02140 
Phone:[masked]

T stop: Alewife (Red line)

Parking: No parking at the venue (yet!) Best to take T.  Otherwise, park at Alewife T station ($7). Park and walk to main lobby of 160 and follow general directions. 

The Hanover CambridgePark is a new luxury apartment building complex in the Alewife area of Cambridge. It has a spacious club room where we'll be meeting, a spa-like pool, fitness center, pool, courtyard with fire pits, grills, high-end finishes, etc. Expect to see many more BostonWine events here in 2015!

For those interested in seeing a model apartment, leasing staff will be on hand before the event to do a tour (call ahead to be sure to get a spot). Remember to let them know that you're part of BostonWine. ;-) 

Look forward to seeing you! 

-Jim

results.description:
From Landmarks:

Dear Friends,

Due to inclement weather and the high risk of lightning in the forecast for this afternoon and early evening, we are moving tonight's free concert to Emmanuel Church, 15 Newbury Street, Boston, MA 02116. 

Due to limited seating, wristbands will be handed out on a first come, first served basis starting at 6 pm. The concert will begin at 7 pm.

For directions and parking information, please visit http://www.emmanuelboston.org/about/directions">http://www.emmanuelboston.org/about/directions.

Though we are disappointed that our concert has to be moved indoors this week, we are delighted that Emmanuel Church is available to us as a rain location!

On days when the weather is questionable, it's tempting to try to stay at the Shell until the last minute and see if the weather clears up, and some people have asked why we can't simply go back to the Shell later in the day if conditions improve.  The reality, however, is that an orchestra is like a huge ship—it can't change directions quickly. In addition to the 60 musicians with their instruments of all sizes, we have a sound crew, a stage crew, instrument movers, volunteers, and many other people to coordinate.  Set up at the Hatch Shell takes all afternoon, and can’t be done if there is rain or lightning in the area.

If you’d like to see how much time and effort goes into turning the Hatch Shell and lawn into an outdoor concert call, check our time-lapse video at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DALiLxKgEIbo">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ALiLxKgEIbo.  It’s fascinating and informative!

Moving and setting up at the rain location also takes several hours, and so decisions must be made early in the day. Even if the weather clears later in the day, the opportunity for turning the "big ship" of the orchestra back around has been lost.

Thank you for your understanding and support, and we hope to see you at Emmanuel Church this evening.  We are confident that we have made the right decision to protect everyone's safety, and to ensure that the show will go on!

Boston Landmarks Orchestra

July 15 at 7:00 pm


(rain date July 15th)

For our July maptime, Carolyn Fish will lead an exercise and discussion on hand-drawn maps. No expertise is needed! We will first look at some beautiful hand drawn maps then delve into drawing out our own mental maps!

We will have pizza, courtesy of CartoDB. We hope you can join us!

As always, beginners very welcome. Please bring a pencil. No need for a laptop this time! 

When you enter the building, check in with security - let them know you're attending Maptime on the 4th floor.

--------

Maptime is, rather literally, time for mapmaking. Our mission is to open the doors of cartographic possibility to anyone interested by creating a time and space for collaborative learning, exploration, and map creation using mapping tools and technologies.

This open learning environment for all levels and degrees of knowledge offers intentional support for the beginner. Maptime is simultaneously flexible and structured, creating space for workshops, ongoing projects with a shared goal, and independent/collaborative work time.

Inspiration for Maptime comes from both hack nights and knitting circles. Both are models of spaces for people to create and learn together. Our goal is to provide this space with an open heart and without pretension. You can bring your own projects to work on, or just hang out and socialize or ask questions. Some people are experts, and some people are just getting started, but all of us are learning, so why not do it together?

Maptime is hands-on, so don't forget to bring your pencil!
results.how_to_find_us: Check in with security at 1 Broadway and take the elevator to the 4th floor.
results.name: Hand Drawn Maps

results.description:
Boston Food Forest Permaculture Speakers Series continues with Josh from D Acres farm!

Come hear Josh share practical examples of alternative building, renewable energy, holistic forestry, no-till gardening, hospitality management, community outreach, and more

For almost twenty years, D Acres of New Hampshire has challenged and expanded the common definition of a farm. As an educational center that researches, applies, and teaches skills of sustainable living and small-scale organic farming, D Acres serves more than just a single function to its community. By turns it is a hostel for travelers to northern New England, a training center for everything from metal- and woodworking to cob building and seasonal cooking, a gathering place for music, poetry, joke-telling, and potluck meals, and much more.

Josh Trought helped to found D Acres of New Hampshire in 1997, and today serves as its director. He is a Phi Beta Kappa graduate of the University of Colorado Boulder with a degree in environmental conservation, and has worked for organizations as diverse as the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and Costa Rica’s Tapantí National Park. Currently he is a member of the Artistic Roots co-op in Plymouth, New Hampshire, and serves as treasurer of the Pemi-Baker Solid Waste District. His proudest accomplishments are as a participant at the Bread and Puppet Theater; at La Caravana Arcoiris por la Paz, a mobile ecovillage that traveled across Central and South America; and at D Acres, where he has specialized in forestry, construction, gardening, and administration. The primary motivation behind his life’s work is the healthy perpetuation of our species within its various, diverse ecologies.
results.name: Josh Trought: The Community-Scale Permaculture Farm

results.description:
Welcome to the weekly BKBS Wednesday meet up. Please join us at 7:00 PM by the 3rd table station in the middle of the top roping / lead area. If you are still by the bouldering wall, keep on walking.

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.how_to_find_us: The third table in the middle of the climbing area between 7:00-7:10 PM. It's the table in the middle of the TR \/ Lead area.
results.name: Brooklyn Boulders Somerville Wednesday

results.description:
A Walk in the Woods: Rediscovering America on the Appalachian Trail
by Bill Bryson
4.05 of 5 stars 4.05 · rating details · 184,398 ratings · 10,342 reviews
Soon to be a major motion picture starring Robert Redford and Nick Nolte.

The Appalachian Trail trail stretches from Georgia to Maine and covers some of the most breathtaking terrain in America–majestic mountains, silent forests, sparking lakes. If you’re going to take a hike, it’s probably the place to go. And Bill Bryson is surely the most entertaining guide you’ll find. He introduces us to the history and ecology of the trail and to some of the other hardy (or just foolhardy) folks he meets along the way–and a couple of bears. Already a classic, A Walk in the Woods will make you long for the great outdoors (or at least a comfortable chair to sit and read in). (less)

results.description:
Type 2 Diabetes is epidemic in our society today, and is a major source of misery – and medical bills! – for a growing number of Americans. Many people afflicted with it have difficulty understanding how or why they got to this point, and believe that pharmaceuticals are their only option. Yet, understanding the underlying imbalances which culminate in diabetes is not as intimidating as it may seem at first. Insulin resistance, the primary metabolic dysregulation at play, is easy to comprehend and can be potently mitigated by dietary strategies and herbal remedies. Learn how to get started!

This class is not intended to replace medical diagnosis or treatment, only to teach you more about your own body and give you the tools to make meaningful changes in your own health.

results.description:
Most Wednesdays we gather for an open gaming night at the Panera in Porter Square. This event is open to anyone, and usually doesn't have any sort of pre-arranged agenda -- anything you can bring is fair game, provided you can get it done in three hours!

* Your gallant host almost always brings something to play, and takes requests if you get said request to him by Tuesday night at the latest. Behold the collection: http://www.bgg.cc/collection/user/CmdrOverbite?gallery=large&rankobjecttype=subtype&rankobjectid=1&columns=title%7Cstatus%7Cversion%7Crating%7Cbggrating%7Cplays%7Ccomment%7Ccommands&geekranks=%0A%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09Board+Game+Rank%0A%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09&own=1&objecttype=thing&ff=1&subtype=boardgame

* Due to logistical concerns and a desire to keep peace with the management (who have been notably chill thus far about a bunch of freeloading nerds taking up their table space), I have set a limit of ten attendees on these events going forward. I doubt this will be much of an issue, given our typical attendance numbers.

* Because our events tend to be small, and the games we typically play tend to be long, if at all possible, please let us know if you plan to be more than a couple of minutes late so that we don't launch into something without you. Likewise, if you're planning on arriving more than a half-hour late, you should be aware that it may not be possible to include you in a game. You're welcome to come by and hang out but the chances are better than even that we'll be hip-deep in gaming goodness by the time you arrive.

* Please be respectful of our hosts; stay mindful of closing time and throw 'em some business if you're hungry.

* Have fun and roll high!

results.description:
Welcome to our regular meetup!  We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing board games -- specifically, the kind of board games that make you think.  We play a variety of games, most of which are Euro style games of medium complexity.

This season, in addition to playing games, we will be raffling off a bunch of popular games!  There will be raffles at each meetup. Simply by showing up, you'll get a chance to win free games. The more often you come, the more entries you'll receive.

Our weekly meetup is in a TERRIFIC space for games steps from the Kendall Square T, with easy parking, and lots of room to spread out in.  Full directions are below.  The building door does get locked in the evening, but there is plenty of foot traffic in and out.  If you expect to arrive later than 8:30, send Tucker a message ahead of time, and we'll make sure someone is there to let you in.

Our meetups happen once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 pm until 11:00 pm or later.

Our group has been running since 2007, and at this point we have a pretty large crowd of regulars.  A lot of people come once every few weeks, and RSVPs are appreciated but not required, so the RSVP list is often smaller than our actual attendance.  We expect about 30-45 people at most of our meetups.

We play whatever people bring, which typically includes a lot of Euros.  Here's a "tip of the iceberg" look at a few games that have been popular lately:

7 Wonders, Terra Mystica, Race for the Galaxy, Splendor, One Night Werewolf, Le Havre, Hansa Teutonica, Machi Koro, Concordia, Super Big Boggle

As you can see, there is some real variety.  A few of our regular attendees bring about 20-30 games between them, so there's always a lot to choose from.  But if you have a game you like, just bring it with you!

People new to Euros are very welcome.  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); the heaviest strategy games (like 18xx or wargames); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

Finally, a note about Settlers of Catan and Carcassonne.  These are traditional "gateway games" that many people play when they first discover Euros.  Although you will occasionally find those games at our meetups, many of us have played them to death and have become more interested in games with a little more complexity to them.

OUTBOUND (from Boston / from Park Street)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the front of the train. Cross the street. (If you take the escalator up, turn around first to see the street.) After crossing, proceed behind the T entrance (perpendicular to Main Street).  Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

INBOUND (from Alewife / Porter / Harvard / Central)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the rear of the train. Take the stairs or elevator straight up. Proceed straight ahead (perpendicular to Main Street). Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

FROM BOSTON (or Memorial Drive)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading north (cross the river if coming from Boston).  Memorial Drive is the first cross street past the river; go past it.
2) Take the first right, onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the first right after Memorial Drive.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

FROM CAMBRIDGE (or points west)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading south.
2) Take a left onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the last left before Memorial Drive; there is a railroad crossing there.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

Once you enter, Room 119 is just past the stairs on the right. There is a suggested donation of $1.00 that goes towards site fees and party supplies.  (You will also receive extra raffle tickets any time you donate.)

Feel free to email with any questions -- we hope to see you at a meetup soon.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk a quarter of a block from the Kendall T, in the opposite direction from the Marriott Plaza. We're in the big building on your right (across from the parking lot). When you enter, our room is just across the foyer and on your right.

Event is in WOBURN!

How’s your health? Now that you are on the journey to attract more of what you want into your life, you want to make sure you have great health & energy to enjoy the good stuff and experiences.

Dr. Geoff DePaula, presenter, will be sharing the wisdom of the yogis’ understanding and practice of the Law of Attraction to help you achieve your highest level of well-being. Come and learn the practice.

He will also share how you can combine this yogi practice with natural healing approaches associated with Integrative Medicine to create youthful energy, a lean body, reduce painful conditions & chronic disease, and live a life of potent & optimal health! 

Integrative medicine is the intelligent use of conventional medicine combined with evidence-based alternative and complementary medicine, to get the “best of both worlds”.

Gifts (we love gifts, don’t you?)

• Recipe book with delicious meals to implement healthy living created by a holistic therapeutic chef

• Shopping lists to make implementation easy

• 1-week sample meal plan to give an “experience” of how you will feel after just 1 week of this approach!

******************************************************

Our Presenter & Guide:

Dr. Geoff DePaula                                                                            www.imhealth.com                                                                                Email: [masked]


<a href="http://www.imhealth.com/"></a>

Dr. DePaula began his journey in the healing arts in 1993, and is a Doctor of Acupuncture with expertise also in Chinese Herbal Medicine.

His vision is to create a “new paradigm” of health care to an integrative medicine model of care,  where fundamental holistic lifestyle changes leads to deep and lasting changes in health, improved quality of life, and the subsequent reduction in health care costs for everyone.

*********************************************************

RSVP "YES" ONLY if you know you are coming. 
Snacks & refreshments will be provided. So, to keep "green" & cost down, please RSVP "Yes" only when you can honor your commitment & be here. 

Many of you have been wonderful with this & we very much appreciate your understanding & support!
